so next up feature management anyone using feature management or
Feature Feature toggling yeah a few nice so feature management is the practice of
decoupling deployment the technical deployment of an newly built or changed
application to the release of features in the hands of your users those are two
different things the one is sort of you have technical tasks of building something and then you need to know does
it work is it the right thing is it the right thing for the right users Etc
so this enables you to do gradual rollouts where you can say that a
certain percentage of my users they will get access to this this feature or it might be a certain User Group you have
identified that these are the users that are the forward leaning they are they can tolerate a little bit insta
instability and something break breaking every now and then but and they really rewarded of seeing and and getting to to
use the new features and you can also use this to do a b testing and if you're not unsure if
their developers are in disagreement with product management uh with regards
to how the features should be implemented you can Implement them both and then you can compare and see which one is performing the best but it does
rely on having good metrics so it's a it's a sort of it's not a coincident
that this this slide is after the monitoring part because we do need good data in order to know that if our
features are the right features and we can start experimenting with them and you also have the inverse of feature
toggling you can have feature of toggling or rollback or fail switches or
whatever you might call them you can actually if something starts breaking and you think you think that this is
caused by this new feature you can turn it off and hopefully if you've done things correct at least your app will
resume working normally minus the new feature of course so at now we have had great success

that the team can then start access it so they can use their backend applications to access
